intro: Altamiranoa virgata, commonly known as the Brazilian nightshade, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and peppers. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom in the evening. Its fruits are small, round berries that turn red when mature. Altamiranoa virgata is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests.
